title: Fogged out when we arrived..still extremely Surreal!
review: The journey is more important than the destination because when we reached there, it was completely blanked out by the clouds. Which in itself was surreal and very beautiful.

title: Beautiful view
review: Its just a point to see the Mango shaped Naina Lake. Hire local taxi (Alto-750 rs. for 6 points) to reach here.

title: Great view
review: One gets a bird-eye view of the Nainital lake.  This is a part of standard sightseeing.  The Nainital lake looks beautiful from this point.

title: Good view but not worth the money
review: The view was good and the ropeway was fun. We were expecting some good view out from here but it does not have that expected view. There are some fun activity over the top to enjoy and they are very adventures such as go-carting.

title: Must visit for the views
review: This is the place to visit if you want great views of the lake and it's surroundings. On a clear day gives a majestic view.

title: View from the top is just amazing.
review: The view of Naini from the top of Naini peak is very awesome as yiu can feel the nature at its best.

title: Good Views Of The Lake
review: Not so far from Nainital, this peak can be reached by a climb and a rope walk way and it is great fun. Not too difficult either.The view was a little disappointing as it was a bit cloudy day when we were there, so we couldn't see very far but we could see the lake.

title: UNFORGETABLE
review: We went to Naina peak through ropeway.Naina peak is unforgetable in respect of natural beauty.This is very romantic place.One can reach to this place through stairs also.

title: Bird’s Eye View
review: Excellent view of the entire city of Nainital and the Nainital Lake from this view point.  Very beautiful spot to hangout for some time and enjoy the scenery.

title: Awesome view
review: Nainital is a lake whuch is shaped like mango and has emerald green water which can be beautifully visualised from this point.

title: Average and nothing exceptional
review: Though the view from this peak is nice, but there was nothing exceptional in it as we had already seen so many such views during our travel

title: Gives the glimpse of whole city
review: A high altitude point 15 mins away from main town gives a spectacular view of the city. Also telescopes at this place helps to see himalayan peaks provided weather is clear.

title: Awesome Point for tourist
review: This is a place worth visiting for every tourist although a bit away from the main city... The views of mountains are majestic and one can relax and sit down at at cafe looking at these mountains...

title: Best view of Nainital
review: One of thr the best things to see in Nainital. Must visit if you are in the town. However like all locations in the town, this would be crowded too.

title: Best view point
review: 8226 ft above sea level. A good place for tracking. Tea and maggie available. Have shade to hide in case of rain or snowfall. Lake view is nearby and one can see china border from peak. Friendly guards, good climate but shortage of water.

title: Unforgettable
review: It was a lovely bike ride nainital to naina peak we enjoyed a lot during ride and nature's views are amazing.....Must visit when you are in nainital......

title: Anil umiyashanker rajgor
review: Amazing PLACE I'll visit ever a best beautiful PLACE in my life nainital the best place must visit in monsoon season

title: amazing view
review: You can get the view if you go to the top by cable car. The view from the cable car is amazing and the lake really looks of the shape of a mango.

title: Greatest View of lake
review: Its near to naini lake, on height, the very beautiful view of lake, looks like mango or eyes. The local transporter can bring you to this places in tour of 7 points.

title: Amazing view from the point
review: Amazing view from the point. Overall kind of trekking place. Drive only you are confident and with strong heart but unique experience of driving in such places.

title: A birds eye view of the lake
review: Location is beautiful and it takes around 20 minutes driving to reach there. You get a great view of the Nainital lake. Other than that, there isn't much to see. This is part of the regular site seeing tour that local cabs offer you.

title: A must visit pont for tourists
review: this is a point from where u can see full view of nainital .. A 4 km ascending walk and u r there.. take water other foods ,,spend good time here

title: Nice
review: We hired cab and driver took us to several points and this was one of them.. the lake is in the shape of mango and in evening with the lights around it look even more beautiful.. if you are nature lover i am sire you will like it..

title: Nice view of entire naini lake - Mango Shape
review: Its a ropeway ride to peak from the Mall Road.  You can see himalayan ranges as local say if the sky is clean.  Food park and play area at the peak for enjoyment.

title: its a 4 km trek
review: this is the highest point in this district. the view of the lake is amazing. u can clearly makeout the mango shape of the lake

title: Glimpse of Mountain
review: I book a Taxi(Rs 800) from my hotel to reach Naina Peak. It was a lovely place to visit. Best tourist spot in nainital Tour.

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful sceneries all around The viewpoint is very good very good experience the place is situated at a very good location

title: Its really a Peak!!
review: From the peak u can see entire Naini Lake and parts of Mall Road with surrounding beauties....... Must visit

title: Excellent place for panaromic view of Naini lake
review: Whil;e the Nainital city is located in valley, the naina peak located in heights provides an excellent view of Naini lake and snow capped Himalayan peaks. One should visit it while in Nainital. Althoiugh you can go by ropeway. the road journey is more rewarding.

title: Cheena Peak
review: Don't know why the name - Cheena peak or China peak. A nice place to take a full view of the beautiful naini lake, the lake from the point appears like a mango, while not completely true. But definitely a great view from the point. You may try trekking to the point or hire a cab ride. we did a cab ride. A very picturesque place to take snaps and enjoy the beauty of nainital.

title: awesome scene
review: its a nice place to watch naina lake its look like mango rest of the scenery is also awesome cool breeze over all good place to visit

title: This is what you should see in Nainital
review: A Must go place to see the beautiful view of lake. It really looks like a Mango shaped Lake, Take a local tour in approx 1000 Rupees and cover all the 11 points of attraction (they said) in NAinital.

title: Amazing View of Nainital Lake
review: Perfect View of Nainital Lake. A best place for Nature Lovers. Here you can spend few hours enjoy some snacks with a balloon shooting game.

title: Bird eye view of Naini Lake
review: From this place you can see Naini lake as shape of Mango. Nice view of lake and city. from This place just 50 meter away there is Himaliyan view point but rarely Himalaya can visible from that place. Kausani is best place to see Himalaya in any time.

title: The best view of lake
review: You get the best view of the Nainital lake form this place.You can see the whole town in one go from here.There are small road side eateries from where you can also eat Maggi.Traffic though can be a mess smtimes out here.

title: Nice View
review: The view of Nainital from the top is really enjoyable. but nothing stunning. Enjoy quire time here..

title: Naini Lake View Point
review: From this peak one can have an amazing view of Naini Lake in Mango Shape. both the corners of the lake are easily viewable from this point.

title: Just take that walk
review: Beautiful walk through nature. Offers great view of one of the most beautiful hill stations in the country. Just sit there soaking in the panoramic view for hours. Carry a book or a hip flask! You will live it

title: A 270 degree viewing paradise
review: The best spot in nainital. Must visit. 3 km trek. Local people still call it by its earlier name 'china peak'. Once reaching you will find a ranger office where you can find little tea Maggie water etc. Then there two short trails(200m), one that is having a full 270 degree view of nainital with a mango shaped nainital lake at another trail you can have a view of pangot valley. Good place for photography on a sunny clear day.

title: Good view
review: Reaching this place is a bit difficult as Google maps shows the wrong directions due to which you will have to keep asking locals to help you get there.

title: Awesome view of naini lake
review: We took local can for this site seen..awesome place to have look at Naini lake from.the peak. Entire lake is of mango shape which can be easily identified from this point.

title: Nainital -A trip made all of a sudden which turned out to be exciting,fun and full of masti.
review: My randomly planned trips are always the best trips. Especially the trips whuch are done via bike.I love to travel and riding bikes on such areas.It happend the same with me visiting Nainital was full of fun excitement and masti with my brother .

title: Good view point of Lake
review: This is the very good view point of nainital lake on the way Himalaya Darshan view point.If you have more interested there someone to see you five another view point of Nainital(not seen by eye but telescope) which is also good.

title: You HAVE to hike to Naina Peak!
review: This was a recommendation by our hotel GM, and despite a little difficulty finding the start of the hike it was a fairly simple hike. Simple in the footing - the altitude made it fairly strenuous. We absolutely loved it, and the views at the top make it all worthwhile!!! You have a clear view of almost 360 degrees of the Himalayan mountains, including clear views of Nepalese peaks.

title: Superb Viewpoint
review: Since Nainital is a hill-station you expect lovely views and you'll never be disappointed. Naina Peak definitely is one of the must visit viewpoint for a different perspective and lovely photos.

title: It was really Awesome
review: Extremely excited visit to Naina Peak. I feel like a magic to see Nainital from the Naina peak.amaging view of Nainital from there. Its overall kind of trekking place. We spend good time enjoyed extremely exciting time.

title: Chestnut view :)
review: This view is very pretty where you can view Naina lake from the hills. The shape of the lake is very prominently visible in the shape of a mango or a chestnut. Overall a must lookout point in Nainital.

title: Naina Peak
review: Excellent view of the lake, the mango like shape is clearly visible. Usually its much more crowded so getting the perfect pic might be difficult.

title: Most Exciting View of Naina Peak
review: It was really nice view of Naina Peak. The best place of Nainital. Need little more stamina to reach peak. Done this in September/2015. Himalayas view is possible in December and May mostly. No other way to reach peak except a little hard trekking through jungles. Get snow in winters was really enjoyable.

title: Superb view
review: The view from this point is really good. The lake can be seen in the shape of a mango. It is also a great place for photographs.

title: Great point to visit. Lovely view for photography.
review: Amazing View - it really looks like a Mango from this point. It's not very safe though as it's on busy road so you have to be really careful while clicking photos.

title: Excellent place to view Nainital from this high point
review: This is the highest point in nainital, must visit. You will get a good view of the nainital. Also the views of the himalayan range are amazing.

title: Horse ride to reach here
review: Get on the horse and ride for about 30 mins to reach at this peak where you can have a spectacular view of surrounding mountains and lake

title: Its just beautiful
review: I must say this peak is beautiful. The lake is in mango shape. The way the nature everything you can just see and relax.

title: Awesome place for a short visit
review: In the peak summer, this is the best place to be in Nainital. A gentle cool breeze gives an amazing feeling and together with the awesome view of surroundings make this one of the best place to be. From the lake area, the ropeway gets you there in a matter of few minutes. Usually there is a waiting period for getting on to the ropeway in peak season.

title: Fantastic views of Himalayas & Nanital
review: Of course depending on the season & weather, this high point is the closest to the plains to provide scenic views of the highest mountains in "classic" India (except now in Sikim).

title: Nice views
review: Nice place to visit and get a birds eye view of the beautiful town and lake. Great place to capture some nice clicks.

title: Best Place with amazing View
review: An Amazing View you can find when you are here. You can see whole nainital from here. I clicked more than hundred photos here.

title: Walking in silence
review: We were a bunch of people but sometimes we walked in silence. Hugging trees and enjoying the flowers.

title: Nice view of Nainital town and the Mango shaped Lake
review: The view from here is marvelous. You can see complete Nainital city and the mango shaped Naini Lake. The place is on high altitude so you can get fresh and cool breeze.

title: Romantic
review: Magnetic attraction, the highest peak of Nainital that invites the edges of Naini Lake.It seems that the clouds descending from the top of the hill are coming to give a message to the lake.

title: Amazing View
review: The view of the Nainital lake is amazing from this place. Good point to take pictures, but one has to be very careful as the road is very narrow and lots of tourists trying to take the pictures.

title: Excellent view of great Himalayan
review: Naina peak is superb. We fully enjoyed there. That is an amazing place. From there, I saw the great Himalayan also.

title: Awesome view
review: Naina peak point is one of the 12 points of nainital darsan tour (1500Rs. Tour by taxi)

title: beautiful lake view...
review: the naina peak was so beautiful....the lake view was superb...good place for clicks... they call this lake as mango lake..as the lake is in the shape of a mango....

title: City view from peak
review: This point comes around 5 kms. from nainital towards pangot road. there is nice view of the city from top. From nearby you can go to khurpa tal and snow view top also.

title: Naina Peak @ Nainital
review: The view of Nainital lake of this place is amazing. We had took snaps from this point and enjoyed lot. Naina Peak is a highest peak in Nainital, also known as China Peak and Cheena Peak. Good to see this photogenic place.

title: a must trek
review: A very very good treking point. You should go there with a guide.

title: nothing to do just a view point
review: List of all peak, points are just a way to earn money by cab driver you will tell you to show around 11 points or more. This is not worth visiting when you are too close to nature then to go at a place and sit which did not have any thing to do

title: great view, costly guide.
review: you definitely can not go there with your own vehicle. You will have to take a guide or a taxi.

title: Scenic spot
review: You can go there early in the morning to get a clear view of the town and the lake. Some exotic birds can be seen, as also monkeys which are not so exotic.

title: Nice view
review: Its a beautiful view point from where you can see the entire Nainital city and the beautiful naini lake. The lake looks like a mango from the top.

title: Tough climb, but well worth it
review: First thing to say is don't stop once you get to the ranger station at the top. There's an additional trail that'll take you out on a ridge and allow a ~270 degree view of the Himalayan foothills and the lake below. Hike is steep but manageable. I would suggest being in reasonable shape before you do this and it's probably not suitable for young children.

title: View of nanital
review: From Naina Peak we can have a bird eye view of Nainital, It is great during day light, but if you can manage, the best in Night when entire city is illuminated.

title: Beautiful Nainital
review: You can enjoy a perfect view of Nainital from this point. you can also see Himalayan ranges from here. Its quite far from Nainital but once you reach there after a long tracking than you actually feel good.

title: Snowy climb
review: Walking about 9 odd km when it was snowing wasnt one of my brilliant ideas. The walk was tiring but not too hard. Though we had a mist covered peak,so the view was obstructed. Yet this was a case where the journey was worth it. Excellent view and memorable walk.

title: Excellent view
review: You can spot famous points of Nainital from here.  The view is really nice and you can spend good time here.

title: Good View
review: Only for a short 5 min stay, very less space to stand and take pics, you are standing on the road while taking pics, so be quick ;)

title: Peak
review: This place is just beautiful.

title: Excellent view of the Lake
review: Though hot it was when we went. the view from this point is spell bounding... We could see the magnanimity of the lake...

title: Mango shape lake view
review: From naina peak you can see the naini lake in a shape of mango and there are activities like gun shots, Restaurant. Not so special place but for first timers may be seen.

title: Perfect Views
review: The peak gives perfect panoramic views across mesmerizing sights of Himalayas and valleys. However, it involves a trek so be ready for it if you head here.

title: Great trek with a fabulous guide!
review: Definitely worth doing the trek if you feel energetic - the view is fabulous. Sunil Kumar from Tranquility Treks was outstanding with his knowledge of the flora and fauna of the area.

title: Looking Good Naini Lake
review: Once you reach Naina Peak naini lake seen a like Mango beautiful view hear its the highest peak point of nainital

title: Beauty
review: Amazing simply Amazing the place is simply beautiful by nature and the sceanic beauty is the USP of the place

title: See Lake in its full form
review: View of lake from this point is awesome. It looks like a mango. No proper place it just on road side. Beware of crossing vehicle while taking pics

title: High range
review: It's again a beautiful spot in Nainital as from here the Naini lake view from above could be seen and it could be said that from this spot the view is awesome.

title: Good climb
review: Walking through to Miuntain Quail. Lots of monkeys in the route and takes you to some beautiful views. Would be quite difficult to walk without a good map or guide. You could drive and walk the last bit.

title: top of nainital
review: an early morning hike to this mesmerising place made my day with a variety of bird spotting all along the way and you get the best best view of nainital from here

title: Naina Peak-View of the lake
review: Naini Peak also known as China or Cheena Peak or Naina Peak is the highest peak in the town, with an altitude of 2,615 m (8,579 ft). and at a walking distance of 6 km (3.7 mi) from the north end of the town (Mallital). From atop the peak, one can not only see a broad swath of the snow clad high Himalaya, but also obtain a panoramic view of Nainital town itself. The summit is an invigorating hike from Nainital town; in addition, for the less energetic visitors, ponies can be hired in Mallital or on Snow View.

title: good top view
review: Its on the top of nainital provides very good top view. one can get the whole view of nainital form this point

title: A Must Visit
review: Wonderful view of the lake all tourists need to visit this place and enjoy the surroundings which will make them spellbound .

title: lovely view
review: nice view from hill top of the  whole naini  lake and its mesmerizing and good for taking snaps of the whole lake view

title: Amazing view of Himalaya
review: The best part of trip was to see Himalaya from the Naina peak. paisa vasool.. The beautiful Himalayan view, several peaks and the greenery was amazing.

title: Nice hike for the urban weary
review: We need a break from Delhi and this was just the ticket.  A stiff 1 hour climb up (3 km route) opened up to fantastic views that stretched from Nand Devi in the north, across the Nepali Himalaya, down to the UP plains - truly impressive and well maintained.  The route down the back (1.5 hours) thorugh the forest was delightful - very pristine and easy to navigate.  We rested at the top of Naina Peak for 30 mins and only saw one other group on a holiday weekend!

title: View Point that amazes
review: Naina Peak is said to be the highest peak point in the town.It is famous for trekking and viewpoint.Youngsters and children must visit this place.From here,You can get amazing and panoramic views of the hills and the city.

title: Usual peak but part of itinerary
review: Went in Nov,2016. We took private car for sight seeing in INR 500 and it showed us 7 points and this was one of them. Its in middle of road and the complete lake would be visible from this point. usual 10 mts point. Nothing great from my point of view but yes part of trip..

title: Get full view of lake
review: See the full lake view from this point. Nothing special there it is on the road while passing through.

title: great view
review: you can go by rope way and lovely view of himalaya range from top and view of nainital. worth visiting and spend time in nature

title: Nice view
review: Very nice view from the top of mountain. very beautiful and clean. managed very well. Must visit this place.

title: Excellent
review: You must go here. The view of the lake is spectacular from this point. Have some maggi noodles and you will enjoy every breath you take.

title: Place is beautiful
review: Anyone goes to nainital, must visit this place. You can view nainital town from the peak. Also it has better view of naini lake. Peak has something better to feel. Worth going on the top.

title: Ultimate views of Nainital Lake
review: The view from Naini Peak or Naina peak is probably the highlight of our trip, where we gottu see the panoramic view of the Nainital lake surrounded by lush green mountains. Its a must-visit. The peak is approximately 3-4 kms from the town and is reachable through vehicles. The roads are good enough.

title: top of the hill
review: from here you will see the lake looks like in mangoes shape and people enjyoed alots here and spents some time with the friends.

title: near  nature
review: whole nanital view from there pins and nanitaleaceful carm beautiful view  of mountains and .its place to have a look of village and .no shop for  snacks ,dont take heavy  items along with u and wear heavy clothes ,this is on the top so u have  to visit on hoarses only, they sta over for five to ten min only

title: Just a view from Top
review: Its a hill journey and you get the birds view of Nainital from here... also telescope people would be available to show you different attractions... including Himalayan peak...

title: Mesmerizing view of highest location
review: This point is at the one of the highest elevations  of Nainital ... if you are nature lover and want the enjoy the sound of silence ...please visit this location .....

title: Nice hike and a great view
review: Those who like to get on to a moderate hike with a good track of 3-4 km mostly uphill, this is ideal. My 6 and 3 year old kids made it to the top in 1.25 hours with some motivation, chips and frooti! The view of top is wonderful, you can see the whole lake and town of Nainitaal if the clouds allow it. You can also get views of Himalayan ranges, again if the clouds allow it.

title: Highest mountain peak in this region !!
review: The Naina peak is an amazing sight to observe while in Nainital. The snow capped mountains look mesmerizing. The snow view point is awesome to enjoy the same. One can also take a trip to Mukteshwar to get a closer look at the Naina peak and the other 5 peaks in its vicinity.

title: Great View From TOP
review: At about 3-4 kms from main Nainatal the top offers breath taking views of Nainatal. Vehicles reach the top .

title: Good to see the city from Top
review: Nothing much to do. Best way to go there is via rope way as it is less costly, time saving and some adventure can be done on top e.g. Shooting, car racing etc.

title: Good peak
review: The peak offers good views around Nainital and is a good lookout and scenic view point. Worthy a stop.

title: Top of Nainital
review: Highest point of Nainital. Recommended only for people who can walk 5 km. uphill. It has a nice view of the town and the lake and the plains beyond.

title: Bird's eye view of lake
review: Good point to see the lake from above. There are vendors with telescopes to show you other peaks and points.

title: Nice Place
review: It has a nice view of the town and the lake.This is an excellent point for taking photos.Super location to see the naina valley and beautiful Naianital.

title: Paranormal view of Nainital
review: This place can be reach by Aerial rope way or CAB or walking if you are used to walk in hills, from this point tourist can enjoy full view of Naini lake and eagle view & 350 kilometers long spectacular views of Himalaya snow caped peaks. The rope way starts from 10 AM- 4 PM INR150/- per person.

title: Eye Candy....
review: Once You Reached at Naina Peak And See The Majestic View; You Would Be A  Statue For A While, Awesome View, Awesome Weather; Must Visit Point Of Nainital... Whole Nainital In Your Eye....

title: Nanital Trip
review: Must visit place away from peak season crowd of Nainital. View is amazing and worth going to the top.

title: Cheena Peak
review: This is the highest point in Nainital.From here Ninital appears as a vast bowl,You can walk or take ponies to the peak.It is advisible to carry food and water.

title: Nice place
review: If you are nature lover then go for it. From the top, view is really beautiful and place is full of peace. You will get some good clicks with your partner or friends. Must visit place.

title: Naina Peak
review: A breathtaking view of the Nainital Lake.  Accessed by taxi and through very small hill roads.  If you have a big car don't take it there!

title: Naina Peak Visit
review: At Naina Peak you can see the natural beauty of Nani Lake & their near location.

title: Super location to see the naina valley and beautiful Naianital
review: It is amazing experience to go by the rope way to the Naina Peak and see the lake and Nainital from such a height and the beauty of the place is mesmerizing.

title: Must visit place if u visit nainital
review: Awesome scenic beauty for u to see at Naina peak. Won't be disappointed with view of the town and lake.

title: Mesmerizing View
review: In winters you can will walk on fresh snow and trekking is not that easy . But once you reached its worth every effort.

title: FOR AN AWESOME VIEW OF NAINA LAKE
review: This is a point from where the entire Naina lake can be seen in its marvellous entirety.  It glistens in the morning sun surrounded by nice greenery.  This is an excellent point for taking photos and videos.  The point is far away from the town proper and tour operators offer this as an important place of visit along with others.  Miss not to see this.  It is awesome.

title: You must reach there to see the best of Naini Lake
review: This is the place from where you can get the brethtaking view of Naini Lake and the whole of Nainital. This is the place from where you can differenciate among Nainital, naini lake, Tallital and Mallital. A must visit site. This is actually a spot on the road passing through the peak. Dont expect it to be a picnic spot.

title: Nice place
review: The place gives you a view of the Nainital lake and the surroundings.  The narrow winding roads in a cab will thrill you and your family.  You can just enjoy the view from the top

title: To do Apart from lake in Nainital
review: When you visit Nainital you visit the same for enjoying the lake and mall road. However there are other small attaractions like this where you can take a local taxi which takes you to such place as walking may be difficult for some people.You get a beautiful  view of lake and Nainital town from aheight where lake looks like a pear from top.So you can enjoy fresh hill breeze as this is on height compared to town and nice view of town.Recommended time to go there is forenoon as view is better in morning time as there is no haze.

title: A view to Himalayas
review: We accessed this via cable cars. You get 1 hours time to spend here. Money is worth the excellent view you get of himalayas. Great view with sunshine.

title: naini lake from hill top
review: we got to this peak by hired car but did some horse riding nearby.

title: Good view
review: This place gives a good view of the lake and the city. The lake seems like an eye or a mango. The place is chill and relaxing.

title: Nice View
review: very nice view of Naini Lake from here. Highly recommended. This is easily accessible on Panggot road

title: Love the View,
review: Really liked the View from Naina Peak and You will see whole Nainital and Naini lake from there and Naini lake view is too good

title: Great view of the Naini Lake
review: From this place you get a great view of the Naini Lake , you can easily see the crescent shape of this magnicificent greenish blue lake. Further above , you can see the snowcapped peaks of the Great Himalayas .

title: Good view point to see the entire lake
review: From among the slopes of this hill, you get a really good view of the nainital lake. You can see the full lake in the famous pear shape with blue glistening water.

title: Naina Peak... View ... WoW !!!
review: Nice peak at the Top.... Very Good View of Nainital ...... Enjoy.....Nature around.... Visit when ever you are in Nainital

title: Great view of lake
review: You can get an excellent view of naini lake from naini peak.View of the lake and surroundings is great .But not many people visit it now b'cause of tough climb.ponies are available .The mountain views are marvellous and amazing.

title: Good View of Naini lake
review: View of Naini lake from top. Will be a good picture from here, if you have an SLR to capture the entire location.

title: View of entire lake
review: Gives a complete view of entire lake and city. It looks amazing and beautiful! Good spot to spend a few minutes. It's a main road so cannot spend a lot of time.

title: Naina Peak
review: the third recommended peak viewing point at nainital,

title: One of the most awesome place of nainital
review: I always remember this place because this place is at the highest altitude in nainital and surround by beautiful flora and fauna if you are lucky you may spot some wild life and when you will reach at top trust me its amazing but you know what i don't want to even explain how beautiful it is, I want you people to see that view trust me its nothing like you have ever seen before. As I am hardcore traveler I decided to track this place and it took me 2 hour to reach their from mall road my legs was paining little bit but when I reached there it was beautiful my all the pain was vanished . One of the best part is you can see the whole snow capped mountains range and some of the mountains covered in this range are Trishul and nanda Devi and many more. Next time I am planning to stay their for one night i will carry my tent because their is no place to stay and to spot leopard or beer, if I am lucky I might spot one . live life and have a safe journey ..

title: Naina Peak Highest Peak in Nainital
review: Not for the fain hearted. A long trek from the flats . One can   walk to this peak from two  sides - either go to Snow View and take the bridle path  or go via Devpata Lodge - last house near the local polytechnic . For those venturing via  Snow View one can also club it with a ride on the cable car ( and save some tired legs &  make a trip to both Snow View and Naina Peak . Part of the Himalayan ranges greets you on side and a spectacular view of Naini Lake on the other . Visitors are advised to keep away from the edges .  .

title: Ropeway!
review: You can reach here by tracking or by car or by ropeway.

title: Pure Nature and Iconic Views
review: Naina Peak is the highest one can get in Nainital range. A trek of 5 Km plus (if you start from mallital) become tranquil ones you cross forrest check post on Kilbury road.If you are not quite fit physically, than take a car till forest check post towards kilbury and start midway just after crossing hotel Anamika. Trek is moderate difficult. It is best to start early in the morning. Don't forget to carry water but avoid extra things except camera. Ones you are at highest point you will find forest rangers check post at the top itself. Though unofficially, you may ask maggy and hot tea which is sold by them. There is no shop etc after midway forest checkpoint so carry your stuff if you need.

title: Awesome view
review: Highest peak of nainital. About 5 & half km away from naini devi temple. great curvy road to travel. Panoramic view of nainital & the lake from such height. must have good zooming camera to take pic. A beautiful and jaw opening view of naini lake & city.

title: OK for taking pics
review: Its a very small place from where you actually get the overall arial view of Nainital, view is very good, but this place itself is right on a turning point of a road and therefore one always need to be very careful, just take some pics, give a look and move on.

title: naina peak
review: very amazing view of naini lake and sorrounding beauty............must visit to this peak to get aerial view of nainital..u can also see the hills of almora and ranikhet...

title: Breath Taking View
review: Its give you amazing view of nanitaal.The lake looks amazing from up there. Highly recommended place to visit

title: Top of the city zoo
review: The zoo is situated on the top of the city you had to go by car .the zoo is kept in very nice condition with lots of different animals and bird's and all the animals in good healthy condition .only the things mind for the people is you had to walk on the top the hill to see the zoo. Old age people can't do that and they sit down wherever they got to sit

title: Excellent view of Himalayas
review: From this place one can see china by telescope and some important things of like. this place must be visit by any traveller

title: Tough trek rewarded
review: China Peak was renamed naini Peak decades ago. It is still a charming trek indeed enjoyable. Those not keen to walk have the comfort of cable car support also available, but the taste is in the two legged pudding!

title: Panorama of Nainital
review: beautiful view from heights. worth watching. Hire a car for the trip, he will take you to the tatal points. can visit in a day.

title: Good Aerial view
review: Good place to visit for an aerial view of Naini lake. It presents awesome view of Himalayas..a place worth visiting while in Nainital...

title: Panaromic view of Himalayas
review: If you love natural beauty this is the place for you. Snow clad white mountains (on a clear day) will welcome you with  cold Himalayan breeze touching you. This is the highest peak in Nainital and climbing straight rocks not easy. However you will forget all blues after reaching on the top. Worth seeing.

title: Great View of Nainital from this place.
review: A compulsory to do in your list once you visit Nainital . You can do Himalaya Darshan from this place. Grab a horse and take a ride to Tiffin Top.

title: Beautiful hill
review: This the peak near Nainital from which one can take a view of Himalayas. Beautiful scenes may attract one multiple times.

title: Top of the House.
review: Took the cable car up and walked around. Views were not very good as it was Overcast, must be heavenly during Summers and clear weather. Lots of Places to have snacks, though most of them serve Maggi and its various versions. God knows what they are doing now after the Maggi Ban.

title: Best view of the lake and surroundings
review: This is a busy road and best in early morning. The views are lovely on one side the Nainital lake and other side the Himalayas.

title: Breathtaking!!
review: Beautiful place.. Loved every inch of it.. Absolute greenery, with all those corniferous trees on hilltops.. Hundreds of small waterfalls.. Totally loved the view and the place..

title: highest peak in nainital
review: Naina peak is the highest peak of the town , at an altitude of 2611 mts. and at a distance of 6 Kms from the town .It commands an entrancing view of sparkling snow laden Himalayas from Bandar Punch in west to Api and Nari peaks of Nepal in the east , a full Himalayan range in one side and a birds eye view of the lake city of Nainital in its full grandeur on the other. With a pair of binoculars a good panorama of the tract surrounding Nainital is obtained . Pony or Horses can be hired to visit this peak either from Snow view or from Mallital.

title: Get a view of the sparkling snow laden Himalayan range
review: This peak is a trekkers paradise, so take a trek as this mountain has numerous routes to explore and reach to the summit.

title: Are you lucky enough to see the Himalayas?
review: Naina Peak is a half an hour uphill drive from Mall Road...Its nothing but a place / point on the ghat to view the Himalaya Peak..Honestly you will find these beautiful peaks from anywhere and everywhere....Though you may go to the Naina Peak for few clicks...Cheers

title: Probably the best view of Nainital
review: Naina Peak offers probably the best view of Nainital Town and Lake. Worth a visit if visiting Nainital.

title: Secluded n worth it
review: This is not included in the tours the sightseeing guides give you, hence this is a secluded trail, where one can trek up 3 km for a good view of the naini lake on one side and the snow clad mountains on the other - on a good clear day though.

title: Great Sceeneric place
review: Away from city. have a view of all around Himalaya and also so called China(as described by local People). Over all beautiful scenic place.

title: Enjoyed Hiking Up
review: I loved hiking up this peak. Though I am out of shape and had to huff and puff all the way, I absolutely loved it. There is barely anyone climbing this peak as there are no horse rides or anything. The forest canopy gives you a nice cover and when on top you can get amazing views of the city and the lake.

title: awesome
review: It is one of the best attraction in Nainital, good view and amazing time to spend, a must visit for a tourist.

title: nicee place to see the mountain
review: it is also called china peak it is good when snow is covered on the mountain one can hire horses to visit this peak

title: Must visit place in Nainital
review: Great view from Naina Peak of Himalayan Range. However, the excessive construction of commercial shops has degraded the natural beauty. Great view of naini lake from up there..

title: Breathtaking view of Nainital from this location
review: The view from Naina Peak is absolutely breathtaking as you can see the whole of Nainital from above. The Himalayas can be seen in the background which is virtually a treat. The cool and crisp breeze flowing around makes your trip a really memorable one.

title: Too good..
review: You will find Peace and serenity at this place for sure..The views of pine trees and surrounding hills makes you go crazy and a feeling of happiness and fulfillment would arise within you..

title: very good place
review: it is also one of the top point in nainital from where you can see the whole nainital city and also the naini lake.

title: Happy
review: Very happy place..view of nainital looking fabulous..very good sight seeing..want to go once again..very happy out to there.

title: The best place in Nainital
review: It is the best place. It was full of snow and people were enjoying everywhere. We didn't expect snow when we went but what a surprise.

title: Magnificent View
review: Highest peak of Nainital provides a challenge to the most avid trekkers. Situated about 6 kms from Mallital. The Himalayas ,the vast expanses of Terai regions of Kumaon and Tibet border can be viewed from Naina peak. Provides a magnificent view of scenic beauty.

title: Breathtaking
review: We walked up to the peak from Snow View, then back down via Sukhatal. The route is fairly obvious, with mainly just one path to follow, and people will happily point the way if you are unsure. It is quite long and steep but not difficult if you are reasonably fit.

title: peak
review: amazing view from the top... u can trek ur way up there although it will take a long time... but its worth it as the time is all urs, if u reach there on horse back u will b hastened to go back as the horses can go for more trips... climbing all the way on foot is a mammoth task... and the horse ride can some time trick u by not taking u to the naini peak... they will come down from dorothy's seat... beware...!!!

title: The journey is more enjoyable so is the destination view
review: Naina peak is the highest peak of the town. It's 6 km from town and a ride on horses can take you to the Naina Peak. It provides a beautiful panoramic view of the snow peaks of Himalaya.

title: Naini Peak - November 2013
review: Used the cable car from the lake to the ridge, which was very good. We were very lucky to meet a chap called Sunil Kumar  who guided us along the ridge and up to Naini Peak. On the way, he gave us our best insight into the flora, fauna and issues of the region that we had in our time in India.

title: Thrilling track
review: Visiting naina peak is really amazing experience .. in between the clouds and looking at the naini lake. you can get a full glimpse of the nainital from there and plus point .... best photography from threre

title: must watch...amazing view
review: definitely a must watch. Standing high and beautiful it is the jewel of Nainital. Naina Peak is at an altitude of 2,615 m (8,579 ft).

title: Best place in Nainital, Highly Recommended !!
review: This comes on top of the list of places I liked in Nainital. There is no cable car or road, you have to trek to the top. Most locals would suggest it is very hard trek, as they misinformed me as well while in the way to the top, on the contrary, it is quite easy trek, quite suitable for kids as well

title: the most important thing to do in nainital
review: It takes a fit person to climb up the peak, The journey to the top is exciting and thrilling. It's worth climbing here. The view from the top is awesome.

title: Nothing so special
review: Boring ...Damn Boring.. if you have visited any better hill station u won't like this place at all. I have read so much about these places but when visited i was very mush disappointed.

title: Great Tracking Place with amzing view
review: Its on height and just tracking is available to reach there. Way is much beautiful and few points in mountain is also good.

title: great view
review: This is the highest peak  in Nainital involving a climb of about 5 kms.One can however reduce the climb by covering some distance on motorable road.View of the lake and surroundings is great .But  not many people visit it  now b'cause of tough climb.ponies are  available . This is undoubetedly the most  b'ful spot in Nainital.

title: The Mountain views
review: The mountain views are marvellous and amazing. Don't rush as the beauty just need a few minutes to admire. Go for a walk and you might get to play in snow on the way.

title: Superb view
review: Its a place with superb view of Nanda Devi Peak, Panchuli and Trishul. If weather is clear you definitely you will get a very beautiful view of Nanada Devi. If you walk towards 100 mtr towards South East you will get a beautiful view of Nainital Lake.

title: 3 km one side soft trek
review: 3 km one side soft trek + 5-6 km from city to reach starting point neat tanki bend on kilbury road

title: Highest Peak in Nainital also know as China Peak
review: Well its automatically has the best view to provide of the snow capped 300 kms long mighty himalayas. One should consider going further down to pangot a small village which also is very serene.

title: Peak Must To Be Watched
review: If You Not Taking this place in Your Watched List Then Seriously Add This Place in Your Watch List. Its a View Point. Nice place to Watch. It has Situated with Its Own natural Beauty. Place to be Watched in a Day By a car And Take the Essence of that Place. Its Really Marvelous.

title: must watch for the views
review: definitely a must watch. Standing high and beautiful it is the jewel of Nainital. Naina Peak is at an altitude of 2,615 m (8,579 ft).
